perturbation.original_text: "Loss" includes actions, claims, costs, debts, demands, encumbrances, expenses (including all reasonable attorneys fees, costs and litigation expenses), fines, liens, liabilities and obligations.
perturbation.changed_text: "Loss" includes actions, claims, costs, debts, demands, encumbrances, expenses (excluding attorneyâ€™s fees unless approved by both parties in writing), fines, liens, liabilities and obligations.
perturbation.explanation: By excluding attorney's fees from the definition of "Loss" unless pre-approved, we create a contradiction. Generally, under Maryland law (specified in section 7.4), the definition of recoverable "Loss" in an indemnification clause includes reasonable attorney's fees. This change introduces ambiguity and could make the indemnification clause in section 2.8 unenforceable to the extent it seeks to recover attorney's fees without prior written approval. It conflicts with the expectation under Maryland law that attorney's fees are typically recoverable as part of indemnification unless explicitly excluded.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Maryland contract law regarding indemnification and recovery of attorney's fees.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will remain in force for perpetuity or until and unless otherwise mutually agreed or amended in writing by both parties.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement will remain in force for a limited time or until and unless otherwise mutually agreed or amended in writing by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that the agreement is in force for perpetuity; however, the modified text states that the agreement will remain in force for a 'limited time'. This created a legal contradiction, and adds an uncertainty to the term and enforceability of the agreement. Since the contract is applicable to both parties, it creates a conflicting message on how long it will remain enforced.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law regarding definiteness of term

perturbation.original_text:
4.  RELATIONSHIP OF THE PARTIES

   4.1  The parties will be joint venturers only as to those activities that they jointly undertake for the AMR market as described in section 3 above; otherwise they shall be independent of each other, with full control over their respective activities without the need to account to the other, and independent contractors as to all work performed under separate agreements. Even though the parties will be joint ventureres as to the AMR market, neither party will have the right to bind the other in any way without the other party's express consent, and this Agreement shall not otherwise be construed to make any party the agent, assignee, employee,

  fiduciary, investor, joint venturer, partner, or representative of any other party.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.  RELATIONSHIP OF THE PARTIES

   4.1  The parties will be joint venturers only as to those activities that they jointly undertake for the AMR market as described in section 3 above; otherwise they shall be independent of each other, with full control over their respective activities without the need to account to the other, and independent contractors as to all work performed under separate agreements. Even though the parties will be joint ventureres as to the AMR market, either party will have the right to bind the other in any way with the other party's express consent, and this Agreement shall not otherwise be construed to make any party the agent, assignee, employee,

  fiduciary, investor, joint venturer, partner, or representative of any other party.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'neither party will have the right to bind the other in any way without the other party's express consent' to 'either party will have the right to bind the other in any way with the other party's express consent', we have introduced a legal contradiction. The initial phrase reinforces the limitations of a joint venture, whereas the changed term has now increased liability on both parties, even though there should not be. This now has misaligned terminology.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Partnership and Agency law limitations in Maryland.
